text: is a city in Kanagawa, Japan. It is about south of Tokyo. It was the functioning capital of Japan during the Kamakura period (1203-1333).Hall. John Whitney. (1991). Japan: From Prehistory to Modern Times, pp. 86, 114. In 1250, Kamakura was the 4th largest city in the world with 200,000 people.Cities, Empires and Global State Formation, Institute for Research on World-Systems The other two large cities in Japan at this time were Kyoto and Nara.Hall, p. 123. Kamakura was made a municipality on November 3, 1939. Today, Kamakura is famous as an upper-class area for people to live. This is because of the history and because it is close to the mountains and the sea. ==History== * 1192 (Kenkyū 3, 12th day of the 7th month): Kamakura Shogunate founded by Minamoto no YoritomoHall, p. 359; Kitagawa et al. (1975). The Tale of the Heike, p. 788. * 1252 (Kenchō 4): Large bronze statue of Buddha is completed. * 1293 (Einin 1, 4th month): A severe earthquake; fatalities in Kamakura were estimated to be 10,000 people.Titsingh, Isaac. (1834). Annales des empereurs du japon, p. 273. * 1923 (Taishō 12): Sagami Bay was the center of the Great Kantō earthquake. The disaster caused widespread damage in the region.Hammer, Joshua. (2006). Yokohama Burning: the Deadly 1923 Earthquake and Fire that Helped Forge the Path to World War II, p. 278. Fatalities in Kamakura were more than 2,000 victims.Hammer, pp. 115-116. ==Tourism== Kamakura has many Buddhist temples. The huge outdoor bronze statue of Buddha at Kamakura is world famous."Kotoku-in" ("The Great Buddha"), Kamakura Today. 2002. The city has many Shinto shrines, including * Tsurugaoka Hachiman-gū Shinto shrine Tsurugaoka Hachimangu Shrine is one of the three major Hachimangu located in Kamakura. It is the most popular spot in Kamakura, especially, Yabusame in September is very famous. Tsurugaoka Hachimangu was built in 1063 and became the capital and center of Kamakura Government established by Minamoto no Yoritomo. Turugaoka Hachiman-gu has many beautiful maple and ginkgo trees. In autumn, the vew at this shrine is nice.Kouyou In June, hydrangeas grow. Many temples have beautiful gardens of hydrangeas. The Hase temple is the most well-known of these temples. ==Sister cities== Kamakura has international sister cities. * Nice in France * Dunhuang in the People's Republic of China ==References== == Other websites == * Rudyard Kipling poem, "The Buddha at Kamakura", 1892 * Official web site * Kamakura's Daibutsu * Kamakura's History - Chronological table * * Category:Cities in Kanagawa Prefecture Category:1190s establishments in Japan
